alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead National Recreation Area (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 16 at 12:16AM MST until April 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PDT /8 AM MST/ THIS MORNING TO 8 PM PDT /8 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. Localized gusts to 65 mph possible in the Spring Mountains. * WHERE...All of Clark and southern Nye counties in southern Nevada, as well as the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. * WHEN...From 8 AM PDT /8 AM MST/ to 8 PM PDT /8 PM MST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Pockets of blowing dust are likely. Dangerous boating conditions expected on Lake Mead and Lake Mohave. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong crosswinds may impact travel along US-95 between Las Vegas and Desert Rock. Areas of dust may restrict visibility on I-15 and US-95 south of Las Vegas.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
